article.headline: Marshall 78, Akron 68
article.story: HUNTINGTON, W.Va. (AP) -- Marvin Black scored 15 of his 23 points in the second half Wednesday to lead Marshall to a 78-68 win over Akron. The Zips (13-13, 7-10 Mid-American Conference) extended their two-point halftime lead to 45-38 with 17:50 to play before Marshall reeled off 10 consecutive points to go ahead 48-45. Marshall (11-15, 8-9) finished off a 20-4 run with 8:33 to play to take its first double-digit lead at 60-49. Eight different Thundering Herd players scored during the run that spanned nine minutes. Akron would get within 69-63 with 3:00 to play before Marshall finished Akron off. Derrick Tarver scored a game-high 39 points for the Zips, including 19 in the first half that gave Akron a 36-34 lead going into the break. David Anderson scored 13 points for Marshall, while teammates Enoch Bunch and A.W. Hamilton added 11 and 10, respectively. Marshall out-rebounded the Zips, 38-28, with Black's nine boards leading the way.<
